main: ^There is a memorial set up outside near the alley of the two streets.
^Ronnie Baron A boisterous yet calming voice in our hearts. 12/23/2008 - 11/13/2032
^A couple pictures of the man rest about, he has short blonde hair and a beard, with a distant smile on his face.
^Some show him with other folks and a big smile, a single one of him smiling at a radio booth.
^A man cries nearby, visibly broken up over the flowers and candles. Some people offer things quietly, others look on from afar.
condolences: ^The man perks up and thanks you for your soft words. He stands stiff in the cold for a second, before adding.
^“Robbed in the street." He pauses for a second. "If it can happend to a good individual, who else is next?”
^He kicks over some flowers before drifting away towards the crowd.
crowdscan: ^As you walk through the crowd, something catches your eyes.
^A dark brown-haired man in a straightened shirt stares at the shrine with a look of recognition, before swiftly retreating into the crowd.
^He seems vaguely familiar, but you can't place it.
^You move after him, trying to catch up, but get lost among the streets and cars.
^However, right before you lose him, you notice something fall out of his pocket.
^It's a photo of Ronnie Baron, with some text scrawled on the back.
^"The connection--- what was so important about you?"
